public ref class MemberInfoExtensions abstract sealed

MemberSignature.Value: public static int GetMetadataToken (this System.Reflection.MemberInfo member);
.method public static hidebysig int32 GetMetadataToken(class System.Reflection.MemberInfo member) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function GetMetadataToken (member As MemberInfo) As Integer

Docs.param: The member from which to retrieve the token, as reftype.
Docs.summary: Gets a metadata token for the given member, if available.
Docs.returns: An integer representing the metadata token. The returned token is never nil. If unavailable, an exception is thrown.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method throws an exception if a metadata token is not available for the specified member. You can call <xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfoExtensions.HasMetadataToken%2A> to determine whether a metadata token is available before calling this method.

Docs.exception: There is no metadata token available.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool HasMetadataToken (this System.Reflection.MemberInfo member);
.method public static hidebysig bool HasMetadataToken(class System.Reflection.MemberInfo member) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function HasMetadataToken (member As MemberInfo) As Boolean

Docs.param: The member to analyze, as reftype.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a metadata token is available for the specified member.
Docs.returns: if there is a metadata token available for the given member; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
<xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfoExtensions.GetMetadataToken%2A> throws an exception if a metadata token is not available for the specified member. So use this method to determine whether a metadata token is available before calling <xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfoExtensions.GetMetadataToken%2A>.
